result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order on Request to Appear Remotely /s/ MDZ 09/13/22 
**The defendant and Counsel may appear remotely for any pretrial conference, scheduling conference, status hearing or any other non-evidentiary hearing. The defendant must be personally present for any evidentiary hearing, and for a sentencing hearing if that occurs in this case.

records.addlTxt: Exhibit #P1 Copy of Criminal Complaint

Atty Luczak viewed the Information on ADA Jambois' laptop.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:20 PM Defendant Kristoffer Alexander King in court.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jason David Luczak in court for Kristoffer Alexander King. 

Exhibit #P1, copy of criminal complaint, is marked for ADA Jambois.
3:21 p.m.  Detective Blake Porter is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Jambois.
3:22 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
ADA Jambois would request that the record reflect that the witness identified the defendant.
3:24 p.m.  ADA Jambois references exhibit #P1.
Atty Luczak objects, sustained.
ADA Jambois moves exhibit #P1 into evidence, subject to cross examination.  No objection by Atty Luczak.  
3:28 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Luczak.
ADA Jambois objects, sustained.
ADA Jambois has no further questions.
Witness is excused.
ADA Jambois has no additional witnesses and has a brief argument.
Atty Luczak has no witnesses and gives his final argument.
3:30 p.m.  ADA Jambois responds to the argument of Atty Luczak.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Kristoffer Alexander King
Current: 13175 Marina Way Apt 576, Woodbridge, VA 22191 United States  (Effective: 02-25-2022)
Prior: 2700 S Adams St 107, Arlington, VA 22206
No direct or indirect contact with the child victim with the initials of K.D.A.

2:04 PM Defendant Kristoffer Alexander King in court.  Attorney Kelly Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jason David Luczak in court for Kristoffer Alexander King. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Atty Luczak would ask that his client be allowed to appear via ZOOM as he lives in Virginia.
State does not object but does state some issues on the record.
Defendant is informed of his right to appear in person.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

State recommends a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.
BY THE COURT:  
ZOOM appearance is granted.

Victim notification has been completed by the State.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
